verses.verse: (Lev. 26:17, 36; Prov. 28:1) There they are in great fear Where no fear was, For God has scattered the bones of him who encamps against you; You have put them to shame, Because God has despised them.
(Ps. 14:7) Oh, that the salvation of Israel would come out of Zion! When God brings back the captivity of His people, Let Jacob rejoice and Israel be glad.

Answered Prayer for Deliverance from Adversaries To the Chief Musician. With stringed instruments. A Contemplation of David (1 Sam. 23:19) when the Ziphites went and said to Saul, “Is David not hiding with us?” [1] Save me, O God, by Your name, And vindicate me by Your strength.
Hear my prayer, O God; Give ear to the words of my mouth.
For strangers have risen up against me, And oppressors have sought after my life; They have not set God before them. Selah
Behold, God is my helper; The Lord is with those who uphold my life.
He will repay my enemies for their evil. Cut them off in Your truth.
I will freely sacrifice to You; I will praise Your name, O LORD, for it is good.
For He has delivered me out of all trouble; (Ps. 59:10) And my eye has seen its desire upon my enemies.

Trust in God Concerning the Treachery of Friends To the Chief Musician. With stringed instruments. A Contemplation of David. [1] Give ear to my prayer, O God, And do not hide Yourself from my supplication.
Attend to me, and hear me; I (Is. 38:14; 59:11; Ezek. 7:16) am restless in my complaint, and moan noisily,
Because of the voice of the enemy, Because of the oppression of the wicked; (2 Sam. 16:7, 8) For they bring down trouble upon me, And in wrath they hate me.
(Ps. 116:3) My heart is severely pained within me, And the terrors of death have fallen upon me.
Fearfulness and trembling have come upon me, And horror has overwhelmed me.
So I said, “Oh, that I had wings like a dove! I would fly away and be at rest.
Indeed, I would wander far off, And remain in the wilderness. Selah
I would hasten my escape From the windy storm and tempest.”
Destroy, O Lord, and divide their tongues, For I have seen (Jer. 6:7) violence and strife in the city.
Day and night they go around it on its walls; (Ps. 10:7) Iniquity and trouble are also in the midst of it.
Destruction is in its midst; (Ps. 10:7) Oppression and deceit do not depart from its streets.
(Ps. 41:9) For it is not an enemy who reproaches me; Then I could bear it. Nor is it one who hates me who has (Ps. 35:26; 38:16) exalted himself against me; Then I could hide from him.
But it was you, a man my equal, (2 Sam. 15:12) My companion and my acquaintance.
We took sweet counsel together, And (Ps. 42:4) walked to the house of God in the throng.
